Narcissistic personality disorder (NPD) is a mental health disorder characterized by extreme self-centeredness, an inflated sense of self-importance, and a lack of empathy for others. People with NPD may have an exaggerated belief in their own abilities and achievements, and they may constantly seek attention and admiration from others. NPD can negatively impact personal relationships and social interactions, and individuals with the disorder may struggle with feelings of insecurity and low self-esteem. It's important to seek professional help if you suspect you or someone you know may have NPD.

Continental Flight 1713 crashed on November 15, 1987, during a snowstorm at Denver's Stapleton International Airport. The cause of the crash was determined to be a combination of factors, including the pilot's failure to abort the landing as required by procedures, the plane's excessive landing speed, and the presence of icing on the wings. These factors resulted in the plane's failure to gain altitude and subsequently crashing into a road and hitting a nearby building. Unfortunately, all 28 passengers and 5 crew members on board were killed in the crash.
